unnormalised: Someone asked me how to plan a big event, and honestly, it's a rollercoaster! My cousin Priya's wedding was last year, and it was a crash course in event management. The initial plan was to have the sangeet on 10/11/2023, followed by the wedding on 12/11/2023. We were aiming for a reception on 14/11/2023, but quickly realised that was overly ambitious.
normalised: Someone asked me how to plan a big event, and honestly, it's a rollercoaster! My cousin Priya's wedding was last year, and it was a crash course in event management. The initial plan was to have the sangeet on tenth november two thousand and twenty three, followed by the wedding on twelfth november two thousand and twenty three. We were aiming for a reception on fourteenth november two thousand and twenty three, but quickly realised that was overly ambitious.

unnormalised: The biggest challenge was coordinating everything from different time zones. My uncle, who lives in the US, was supposed to finalize the caterers by 20/09/2023, but the time difference made communication tricky. We ended up having video calls at odd hours – 2:00 AM IST sometimes, which was not fun. Also, the panditji kept changing the auspicious time for the ceremony! Initially, it was supposed to start at 11:00 AM, but then he moved it to 10:30 AM. Talk about stress!
normalised: The biggest challenge was coordinating everything from different time zones. My uncle, who lives in the U-S, was supposed to finalize the caterers by twentieth september two thousand and twenty three, but the time difference made communication tricky. We ended up having video calls at odd hours – two A-M I-S-T sometimes, which was not fun. Also, the panditji kept changing the auspicious time for the ceremony! Initially, it was supposed to start at eleven A-M, but then he moved it to ten thirty A-M. Talk about stress!

unnormalised: And then, there was the venue booking. We wanted the grand hall at the ITC hotel for the reception, and they told us it was available on 14th Nov. Then, just two weeks before the event, they called to say there had been a double booking! We had to scramble to find another place, and finally settled on a banquet hall that was available on 15/11/2023 at 7 PM.
normalised: And then, there was the venue booking. We wanted the grand hall at the I-T-C hotel for the reception, and they told us it was available on fourteenth november. Then, just two weeks before the event, they called to say there had been a double booking! We had to scramble to find another place, and finally settled on a banquet hall that was available on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three at seven P-M.

unnormalised: In the end, everything worked out, more or less. But if I had to do it again, I'd start planning at least 6 months in advance and hire a professional event planner! Trust me, it's worth the investment. You want to enjoy the event, not just spend the whole time running around putting out fires.
